Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

I just wanted to say that the new facelift on Mun and on Kerbin is absolutely gorgeous; love it. One question I have, though, is if/when are any of the other planets getting the same sort of facelift? I love the terrain on the two with all of their rugged features, but it'd be awesome to see more of that.

Also, what is there in the way of new things to do coming? Like soil sampling and other stuff.
Extra hills on the Mun make finding a flat spot to land rather more difficult, and I haven't tried driving a rover there yet, but I imagine it's going to be fun.

I love 0.21 so far. Based on what I have noticed Kerban seems to have had some kind of moderate retexturing done to it. Aside from the area right around the KSP center, some of the mountains now are snow covered peaks and there's a river that I have never noticed before on the other continent. I've only been to the Mun, and orbited Kerban so far so I don't know about anywhere else yet. Looking at sending a probe to Minmus next to check it out, and then perhaps Duna.
Eve definitely looks different. The layout of the planet looks to have been changed.

Duna has had some changes apparently. Have yet to go there, but from the tracking station it looks flatter overall, but more rough. Matte, I guess.

Eve is pretty similar: flat, but rough. Here's hoping the tallest point has not been lowered, because launching from there does not need to be harder...

IIRC, five places were redone, so with Eve, Kerbin, Duna and Mun, that leaves one. Anybody?
I believe the fifth planet to receive changes is Moho, although I am not 100% certain.
From what I can remember it was Kerbin, Mun, Eve, Duna, Moho that had new terrain. Also Ike got brighter, which might be due to the new lighting improvements.
Little off topic. But Driving a Rover on the new Mun IS awesome and the hills make your rover into a plane in no time.

I did a flyby of the Mun as soon as I got 0.21:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

It's beautiful.

I did a flyby of the Mun as soon as I got 0.21:

-snip-

It's beautiful.

I agree, it's looking fabulous. I'm real happy with what Squad has done to everything.

I took a ship to Mun yesterday. It wasn't so bad, even if i landed on a slope inside one of the small craters inside a huge crater .

http://i.imgur.com/RyYpbRD.png

http://i.imgur.com/FzRvXhk.png

http://i.imgur.com/Gf5G3IO.png

I guess if i'd landed near the middle of that crater ground would be nice and flat, but at least i got some nice views.

I did a flyby of the Mun as soon as I got 0.21:
Javascript is disabled. View full album

It's beautiful.

I just wanted to say I like your satellite design. Very compact.
I'm loving the new mountains west of the space center.

I was hoping part of the delay in releasing 0.21 was some tweaking being done on the MÃƒÂ¼n...but it appears not.

It still has basically two different sizes for the small craters...

And lots of craters on the maria...

And the craters have dark bottoms.

None of this looks realistic. I think the idea of procedurally generated craters is great, and this looks cool and all...just not realistic.

The changes to Eve have got me reconsidering where I'll land the Eve boat, with all the little islands that seem to have appeared. Decisions, decisions.

Well, gotta build the final Eve boat too.

I was hoping part of the delay in releasing 0.21 was some tweaking being done on the MÃƒÂ¼n...but it appears not.

It still has basically two different sizes for the small craters...

And lots of craters on the maria...

And the craters have dark bottoms.

None of this looks realistic. I think the idea of procedurally generated craters is great, and this looks cool and all...just not realistic.

I noticed that too, the Mun now looks like it has a bad case of Acne I mean look at it, did ALL of the craters have to have such dark basins?

I mean look at it, did ALL of the craters have to have such dark basins?

On another thread, Nova said he may want to tweak it. Maybe keep your bases outside the craters for now. But then, we don't know what might happen.

Edited July 27, 2013 by Tw1

Yes, like peoples comments from the teaser pics, I agree with others that it could use some tweaks.

However... I suspected that it would look a lot better close up, say at a low and fast 6km high orbit. I was right.
Id like the Mun to be a bit lighter - more like ours. Its currently not that prominent in the nights sky.
I think the amount of craters is simply excessive. It'd be nice to have some areas that are crater free. I liked the previous Mun, but it could have used more craters, but this is way over the top.

No...the craters aren't realistic at all...

(PS: I love it, well done Harv).

No...the craters aren't realistic at all...

(PS: I love it, well done Harv).

thats a lot of craters.......

thats a lot of craters.......

Reality is funny that way.

There are too many dark basins, but that's because the procedural craters are always generated with them. There should be two types of procedural craters instead of one.

Edit: From this view, it looks fine.

Although a little too dark.

Edited July 26, 2013 by Giggleplex777
Guys, it's not our Moon. It's a satellite orbiting extrasolar planet. It's different - plain and simple
